column4: Can someone please help me.  I am trying to establish an internet connection with Belking Wireless G Router.  I can connect to the router, but it seems to not be routing to the internet. Any assistance would be great.
can you ping the router?
yes.
try pinging google
Doesn't work.
I used the numerics from a website I found.
does the router interface say its connected?, can you connect via ethernet?
you need to set the router via the web interface..
I'm not having any luck.
I have tried that.  Something is wrong.
did you try the wizard?
Yes.
were you connected directly from the modem to computer before you connected the router?
Yes.
I am currently connected using the wireless router under Windows xp.
do you mean to say that you can connect wirelessly to the internet from a windows machine via the router?
Yes. That is what I am doing now.
For some unknown reason, ubuntu is giving me a headache.
can you ping your windows machine?
rather.
try releasing the ip from windows by ipconfig /release then try booting into ubuntu
Okay, I will try that.
